summary: The National Telecommunications and Information Administration provides grants through the Tribal Broadband Connectivity Program to expand broadband access on tribal lands. The grants reached 31 recipients who haven't received federal broadband help before. Some grants will help Tribes build their own networks. These networks will serve areas that have not attracted private-sector investment due to their remote location and low population density. But it will...
title: Tribal Broadband: Additional Assistance to Recipients Would Better Support Implementation of $3 Billion in Federal Grants
